children.subject: ^ Keep in mind that workload can be heavily dependent on the instructor.
Cog Sci is pretty easy and don't need to spent that much time on it. 70 is much easier than the semester long since the course will adjust to summer's length. therefore, it should be doable.
By 2 year ago, do you mean 2013? With Tom Watson? Was that really much less than work than in the regular semester?

70 is much easier than the semester long since the course will adjust to summer's length This is not necessarily true, it depends on the instructor. When I taught 61A, it was just as rigorous as during the fall and spring (we covered the material twice as fast to make it fit in the summer).
Yes I took it with Tom Watson

I TA'd for 70 last summer and last fall (and was a reader in the spring). Our head TA had also taught the previous summer under Tom, so I would assume that these two past summer iterations weren't substantially different.

We were a bit time-pressured to teach all the material near the end, and we did cut out a bit of the more advanced stuff (like CLT and Chernoff bounds, and we only briefly touched on hash functions and cardinality of infinite sets), although we had done some other stuff like CRT and a bit of Bayesian inference that isn't always taught. So material-wise, I don't think that the summer students missed too much of the 70 material.

The workload during the summer was certainly intended to be more than an average class's workload during the school year (I don't think we exactly reached twice a regular semester's workload as per the usual rule of thumb, but we were definitely aiming for at least 1.5 times the homework length. Although homework length differs by professor, so I'm uncertain as to what our metric was. And we basically had exams every other week (during weeks 4/6/8), and we wanted less work during those weeks, so maybe homework was a bit light). So, keeping in mind that class time was also almost twice as long (6 hours of lectures + 2 hours of discussion), I wouldn't say that 70 during the summer is substantially easier than taking two classes during the semester. Or at least, we didn't intend it to be.

Keep in mind two double the pace is really tiring! Not to say that you can't do it or shouldn't try but the situation is different. Summer classes don't allow as much time for you to acclimate to material or sleep on it. (Which can definitely be helpful during the year!)
I took CS70 in the summer 2 years ago and the workload is way less than CS70 in the regular semester. I'm not sure about cogsci though

history.content:
Hi,

How intensive is it to do both cog sci and cs 70 over the summer 2015? I am planning on working hard, but I don't want to be so overwhelmed that I don't see the sunlight all summer. I know taking cs classes over the summer can be brutal. Any advice would be appreciated!
history.subject: Cog Sci 1 and Cs70 summer
